user_specs: ['Eye Color Hazel', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Porcelain', 'Skin Type Dry']
review_content:
In a word: perfection. I’m pretty new to this whole beauty thing, and am still trying to figure out which products work best for me — especially as I’m finding that my face likes to throw me curveballs on a daily basis. I have fairly significant rosacea and am also a blood thinner, which while saving my life further flushes my already pale face. When that underlying redness is off the chart, it completely changes how everything, especially blush, looks on me, so I wanted something with a bit of a gradient I could adjust easily. I was slightly worried when I opened this and saw what to my untrained eye looked like glitter, but I literally gasped aloud in delight when I finally applied it. It was absolutely stunning from the get; super easy for rookie me to work with, silky and luminous without being glittery, and I love that I can play with the shade and intensity depending on my daily wants and needs. It looks great with a lot of build, but even just a swipe leaves a beautiful wash of color. It’s also played very well with my skincare and other face products (mainly Dior Forever Matte liquid foundation and both Laura Mercier and Hourglass tinted moisturizers.) I already have Pink Sand in my cart and am so excited to add another Kevyn Aucoin product to my stash, because I know it’ll look stunning. Can’t say enough good things.
…read more

user_specs: ['Eye Color Green', 'Hair color Red', 'Skin Tone Light', 'Skin Type Dry']
review_content:
I’m not sure what I expected from this cheek colour, but I’ve loved each Kevyn Aucoin product I’ve tried, so how bad could it be? When it arrived last week, I pulled this slim, minimalist compact out of the box and tried it immediately. Holy...grail! I don’t think I’ve ever used a single cosmetic that immediately *transformed* my face. This is the most beautiful, delicate blush I’ve ever used. I had zero makeup on when I applied it the first time. It made my face blossom. That’s the only word I can think of that’s a perfect description. I purchased the Rose Cliff shade(s), based on my slightly peachy skin tone. It’s a powder blush, which I’m trying to avoid because women over 50 should usually stick to cream or liquid blush; the powder can cake easily and settle into lines & crow’s feet. But the Neo-Blush is a creamy, silky powder that applies beautifully, smooth as a cream or gel on dry, aging skin. The colour was ridiculous! SO rich, but subtle and artistic. It looks like an actual blush that your skin creates naturally. It won’t settle into fine lines, has no sparkle or glitter, and simply made my face look young, naturally flush, and surprisingly pretty. Even without any other makeup on. The Neo-Blush is designed as a spectrum of colors, ranging from lightest to darkest, where each tone by itself looks great on your skin. I go right for the center color for my cheeks and forehead. Then I use the darker peach-pink tone to contour a small bit under my cheekbones. The color pigment is perfect and lasts for several hours, especially with a light spritz of Caudalie Grape Water (my version of setting spray.) Kevyn Aucoin, wherever he or she may be, is a color genius. I’ve been devoted to my Ilia Color Haze (liquid blush) in Before Today or Warm Haze, and it convinced me that cream/liquid blush is better for over-50 skin. But this Neo-Blush genius powder deserves 10 stars. My face and my husband love this gorgeous product.

user_specs: ['Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Tan', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_content:
I bought Rose Cliff and Sunset. I love these blushes as you can create different looks and still look natural. Great color pay off as well. You get 3 colors in one which makes the price worth it to me. I am tan skinned and these two blush palettes looked great on my skin tone. I do plan on purchasing the PinkSand next. My one MAJOR problem is that when you first purchase the blushes they are sparkly, vibrant, shimmery. After a few uses the shimmer is gone, and the palette becomes COMPLETELY MATTE. Meaning, they top these blushes with shimmer to make it appealing, but really you are buying a matte blush palette. They do not stay sparkly and shiny. Which is a huge negative, because I love the shimmer. It gives you a glow effect, but no longer is a glow effect once the shimmer is gone. I still highly recommend these palettes, though.

review_content:
This blush is so pretty! It has quickly made it into my top five blushes. It's not overly pigmented, so you don't have to worry about looking like a clown all day. It applies, and blends beautifully. I'm in my forties, but I love the healthy glow these blushes give you. It's not a blinding highlight, but a subtle sheen. It gives a, lit from within, glow. I also use this blush on my lids. I blend a bit of bronzer into my crease, and apply the blush to my lids, blending blending upwards towards my crease. It's a gorgeous monochromatic look, and I receive compliments from men, and women, each time I wear this look. I definitely do not need any more makeup, but I think, I'm going to order Sunset too. The color scheme is gorgeous.

review_content:
I'm obsessed. I love this little blush so much. I use my Sigma Tapered Kabuki, and just lightly swirl it in the compact, and it picks up a nice dose of color. When I do go for the red color, I apply with anything that doesn't pick up a lot of product, just so I can get that little kiss of color. Then I put the compact in my bag, and I'm off... because the small size makes it makeup bag friendly.

user_specs: ['Age 35-44', 'Eye Color Green', 'Hair color Red', 'Skin Tone Medium', 'Skin Type Dry']
review_title: This Gradient Blush Palette May Be ALL You Need!
review_content:
This is ONE GORGEOUS palette. I could have picked out a softer color but I knew that Aucoin's line is heavy on pigment and so I went with probably the boldest color palette for this product. The texture is super-silky. It's highly pigmented -which means I can apply sheerly and not have to worry about looking too pale. I start with red (and it's red!) at the far right and use either a brush or an egg sponge to dab at the palette to pick up pigment. I gently and lightly apply the pigment and blend out. I work with the boldest color from closer to the ear then work down to towards my cheeks while on my cheekbone. I use the middle or light range of the highlighter and use it on just above the cheekbones. It would also be fabulous on the eyes. The product is definitely buildable and I am loving playing with this palette! I am a blogger (beauty

user_specs: ['Age 35-44', 'Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Tan', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_title: Sunset and Rose Cliff on tan skin
review_content:
I purchased Sunset and Rose Cliff. I have a natural tan complexion and a yellow/olive undertone. Both of these look beautiful on my skin. I've used these two different ways: Dip a small brush into the higight shade, as a highlight. The middle shade as a blush color. The darkest shade lightly as a contour. Less is more. The colors have quite a payoff. Using it this way won't last once the colors begin bleeding together, which is why I then tried them another way: Swipe the brush left to right to use as a subtle blush color. Swipw the brush right to left for a deeper blush color. The product applied smoothly without fallout. No chunky glitter. This was my first Kevyn Aucoin purchase and I'm very pleased.

user_specs: ['Eye Color Green', 'Hair color Gray', 'Skin Tone Porcelain', 'Skin Type Dry']
review_content:
This was gorgeous on my extremely fair 1Y01 IQ skin tone, and out of all the colors this one had the most shimmer when swatched. The shimmer is mature and not heavy- when applied it blends in and enhances the cheekbones. It would work on a wide range of skin tones, I found I had to be light handed when using it. Sunset seems like it would work for olive and deeper tones. Out of all of them I did not like Pink Sand. I ddn't try it on my face but it was rather plain and when it's colors were mixed it created an odd color of pink, more of what an infection around a cut looks like. I am glad I swatched these in store before purchasing because I would have bought Pink Sand if I had not swatched in store since I am pale and it seemed to be the safest bet. Hopefully this helps others on the fence.
